--- alter_table_add_column_identity.sql
alter table foo add column baz int64 not null generated by default as identity (bit_reversed_positive)
--- AST
&ast.AlterTable{
  Name: &ast.Path{
    Idents: []*ast.Ident{
      &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 12,
        NameEnd: 15,
        Name:    "foo",
      },
    },
  },
  TableAlteration: &ast.AddColumn{
    Add:    16,
    Column: &ast.ColumnDef{
      Null: 41,
      Key:  -1,
      Name: &ast.Ident{
        NamePos: 27,
        NameEnd: 30,
        Name:    "baz",
      },
      Type: &ast.ScalarSchemaType{
        NamePos: 31,
        Name:    "INT64",
      },
      NotNull:          true,
      DefaultSemantics: &ast.IdentityColumn{
        Generated: 46,
        Identity:  70,
        Rparen:    101,
        Params:    []ast.SequenceParam{
          &ast.BitReversedPositive{
            BitReversedPositive: 80,
          },
        },
      },
      Hidden: -1,
    },
  },
}

--- SQL
ALTER TABLE foo ADD COLUMN baz INT64 NOT NULL GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY (BIT_REVERSED_POSITIVE)
